category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Puzzles
sub_categories.description: Solve logical puzzles, brain teasers, and analytical thinking problems.

exercises.title: Logic Puzzles
exercises.description: Solve basic logic puzzles and reasoning problems.

tasks.title: Truth Teller and Liar Puzzle
tasks.question:
Implement a solution for the truth teller and liar puzzle.

Your program should:

  • Handle scenarios with truth tellers and liars
  • Process statements and determine who is who
  • Use logical deduction to solve puzzles
  • Handle multiple scenarios
  • Return the solution with explanation
tasks.hint: Use boolean logic, create truth tables, and systematically eliminate possibilities
tasks.input: Person A says: 'B is a liar', Person B says: 'A is telling the truth'
tasks.output: A is liar, B is truth teller

tasks.title: Logical Deduction
tasks.question:
If all roses are flowers and some flowers are red, what can we conclude?

Consider: Logical relationships and valid deductions
tasks.hint: Think about what can be logically inferred from the given statements
options: All roses are red - invalid deduction
Some roses are red - possible but not certain
All red things are roses - invalid deduction
No valid conclusion can be drawn - correct

tasks.title: Number Sequence Solver
tasks.question:
Create a program to identify patterns in number sequences.

Your program should:

  • Detect arithmetic, geometric, and Fibonacci sequences
  • Find the next number in the sequence
  • Identify the pattern rule
  • Handle complex patterns
  • Return the pattern description and next number
tasks.hint: Check for common differences, ratios, and recursive patterns

exercises.title: Word Puzzles
exercises.description: Solve word-based puzzles and language logic problems.

tasks.title: Anagram Finder
tasks.question:
Create a program to find anagrams of a given word.

Your program should:

  • Generate all possible anagrams of a word
  • Check if generated words are valid
  • Handle words with repeated letters
  • Return all valid anagrams
  • Include word length filtering
tasks.hint: Use permutations, check against dictionary, and handle duplicate letters

tasks.title: Word Relationships
tasks.question:
What is the relationship between 'doctor' and 'patient'?

Consider: How these words are related in meaning
tasks.hint: Think about the professional relationship and roles
options: Professional relationship - one serves the other

tasks.title: Crossword Puzzle Solver
tasks.question:
Implement a basic crossword puzzle solver.

Your solver should:

  • Find words that fit given patterns
  • Use a dictionary of valid words
  • Handle word length constraints
  • Consider letter positions
  • Return all possible solutions
tasks.hint: Use regex patterns, filter by length, and check letter positions
tasks.input: Pattern: C_T, Length: 3, Dictionary: [cat, cot, cut, dog]
